The Chipotle-Lime Marinade will add a fantastic smoky flavor to your tofu, and it will complement the quinoa and black bean bowl perfectly.

**Cooking the Tofu:**

After marinating the tofu, you can cook it using various methods to achieve the desired texture and crispiness. Here are some cooking methods you can try:

1. **Pan-Seared Tofu:** Heat a non-stick skillet or cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Remove the tofu from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Add a small amount of oil to the pan and sear the tofu until golden brown on both sides (about 3-4 minutes per side).
2. **Grilled Tofu:** Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Remove the tofu from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Grill the tofu until charred and crispy on both sides (about 3-4 minutes per side).
3. **Baked Tofu:** Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the tofu from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Place the tofu on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
4. **Air-Fried Tofu:** Preheat an air fryer to 400°F (200°C). Remove the tofu from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Cook the tofu in the air fryer for 10-12 minutes, or until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

**Tips for Cooking Tofu:**

* **Press excess liquid:** Before cooking, gently press the tofu between paper towels or a clean kitchen towel to remove excess moisture. This helps the tofu cook more evenly and prevents it from steaming instead of searing.
* **Don't overcrowd:** Cook the tofu in batches if necessary, to ensure each piece has enough room to cook evenly. Overcrowding can lead to steaming instead of browning.
* **Don't overcook:** Cook the tofu until it's golden brown and crispy on the outside, but still tender on the inside. Overcooking can make the tofu dry and tough.

Now that you have the marinade and cooking methods, you're ready to create a delicious Chipotle-Lime tofu to top your quinoa and black bean bowl!

Remember, practice makes perfect, so don't be discouraged if your first attempt doesn't turn out exactly as you hoped. Keep experimenting with different marinades, cooking methods, and seasonings to find your favorite way to prepare tofu. Happy cooking!
